name: The Trust Bridge
description: A collaborative puzzle experience where teams must share information discovered in separate chambers to unlock a bridge together. Perfect for teaching the importance of communication, information sharing, and trust in teamwork.
author: Realm Engine Team
learningObjectives: Practice clear communication of discovered information
Experience the value of exploring different paths and sharing findings
Understand that some challenges require multiple perspectives
Learn to combine individual discoveries into team solutions
teamBuildingFocus: Communication: Teams must verbally share what they find in separate chambers
Trust: Players must rely on teammates' accurate reporting
Collaboration: Success requires combining information from multiple sources
Active Listening: Teams must carefully process shared information
howToFacilitate: Divide team into two groups or have them explore separately
Group A explores East Chamber, Group B explores West Chamber
Groups must communicate their findings without showing screens
Together, solve the bridge mechanism puzzle
Debrief: Discuss how communication and trust enabled success
walkthrough: 1. Read the Ancient Journal in the Entrance Hall for context
2. Split exploration: one person/group goes East, another goes West
3. East Chamber: Pick up the Stone Tablet and note its inscription: 'TRUST begins the journey'
4. West Chamber: Pick up the Brass Plaque and note its inscription: 'UNITY completes the path'
5. Share your findings with your team (communication!)
6. Go to the Bridge Chamber with both items
7. Use both the Stone Tablet and Brass Plaque on the Bridge Mechanism
8. Cross the now-stable bridge to victory!
debriefQuestions: How did you decide to split up the exploration?
How did you ensure accurate information sharing?
What would have happened if one person didn't share their discovery?
How does this mirror real-world team challenges?
